anime.description: It`s the 25th year of the Taisho Era in Imperial Tokyo. http://anidb.net/ch94081 [Kuze Tsugumi], daughter of aristocrats, agrees to be married to save her family from decline. But before she goes through with it, her younger brother Hitaki gets her involved in an incident caused by a "maremono," a type of book that casts a great influence on whoever reads it. As a result, Tsugumi gains the power to see "aura," a light that represents the emotions that dwell within a maremono. This is the story of a woman whose destiny seems to sway up and down, as if on the delicate balance of a scale. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: alternative past
tag.description: An anime that takes place in an alternative past is an anime that clearly does not belong to the future or the present, and isn`t tied particularly closely to our history, or has ties to our history but only as a premise: there are too many things that don`t make sense for the time-period. In some cases there is futuristic technology present, but the overall setting still feels that of the past. However the setting must still take place on Earth, since we can not know if the history of a fantasy world is an alternate one or not.

tag.name: historical
tag.description: Historical anime have clear ties to our history and usually occur in a particular epoch.

tag.name: game

tag.name: visual novel
tag.description: The two terms are similar yet different, however, the fact that they look and `feel` the same outweighs the technical differences. For clarification, visual novels are considered a sub-genre of adventure games and the term does not cover simulations. While the two genres often share a common visual presentation, dating sims are sometimes considered to be more statistically based than the "choose your own adventure" style of visual novels; basically, the choices you make might change something else than just the story arc (or your next porn pic). Dating sims can involve several technical elements such as a time limit, several statistics such as looks and charm which can be boosted through exercise, or an "attraction meter" which can increase or decrease depending on one`s decisions.

episode.title: 小夜啼鳥の舞踏会 -ナハティガル-
Nightingale Ball: Nachtigal
Sayo Teichou no Butoukai: Nachtigal
episode.summary: As Tsugumi is slowly getting used to her new job with Fukurou, one day, she meets the Prime Minister`s son, Ukai Shougo. Having nearly killed himself due to the influence of a cursed tome, Shougo has come to live at Fukurou in order to recover. While Shougo is rude and utterly selfish, Tsugumi finds herself concerned for him. Meanwhile, when a politician jumps to his death due to a cursed tome Fukurou learns that there may be some connection to the dark auctions held behind the scenes of an illustrious dance hall by an organization known as Karasu. Tsugumi accompanies Shougo in an undercover mission to learn more information. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 焔の神を名乗る者 -カグツチ-
Those Who Take the Name of the God of Flames: Kagutsuchi
Honoo no Kami o Nanoru Mono: Kagutsuchi
episode.summary: Realizing that she could save many people with her powers, Tsugumi has begun her work as a member of Fukurou. However, when she is having a meal with Hayato and the others at the end of their rounds, they hear a ruckus outside. A group called "Kagutsuchi" appears that plunders books from citizens and burns them on the spot. Sagisawa Rui, a victim who had a precious book burned, asks Tsugumi for her help in resolving this problem. He says that rumors are spreading of strange books such as the one that caused the Prime Minister`s son to commit suicide. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 帝国図書情報資産管理局 -フクロウ-
The Imperial Library Intelligence Asset Management Bureau: Fukurou
Teikoku Tosho Jouhou Shisankanrikyoku: Fukurou
episode.summary: Books containing the intense emotions of the author, sometimes with the power to force the death of their readers, these books are known as "cursed tomes". The role of the Imperial Library Intelligence Asset Management Bureau, nicknamed Fukurou, is finding and retrieving these books. As a result of the incident with her brother, Tsugumi has gained the ability to see the auras around cursed tomes and decides to join Fukurou to put her new powers to use. However, she finds Fukurou full of rather unique members such as Ozaki Hayato with a sharp-tongue and a strong sense of justice, Kougami Akira who has difficulty with people, and Hoshikawa Hisui with mismatched eye colors. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 稀モノの煌き -アウラ-
The Glow of the Cursed Tome: Aura
Mare Mono no Kagayaki: Aura
episode.summary: In a Japan where the Taisho Era didn`t end after 15 years but went on for another 10 additional years the eldest daughter of the financially declining Kuze family, Tsugumi, resolves herself to a marriage she doesn`t desire for the sake of her family. However, Hitaki, her younger brother, vehemently opposes the marriage and after a fight with Tsugumi, shuts himself away in his room and attempts to kill himself. Tsugumi blames herself for her brother`s suicide, but two mysterious men appear identifying themselves as part of the Imperial Library Intelligence Asset Management Bureau and reveal that her brother`s suicide might not be as clear-cut as it seems. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ようこそ帝国図書情報資産管理局へ
Episode S1
Youkoso Teikoku Tosho Jouhou Shisankanrikyoku e
恋火の彩 -ヒゲキ-
The Colors of the Flames of Love: Tragedy
Koihi no Irodori: Higeki
episode.summary: Confessing to being the spy within Fukurou, Akira leaves after pledging to Tsugumi that he will protect her. Rattled by the revelation of his betrayal, the other members are unable to hide their upset. After leaving Fukurou, Akira heads straight for Shiginuma to angrily confront him for his threats to Tsugumi. Meanwhile, Tsugumi learns some surprising new information about cursed tomes from Nabari. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雨降り映畫館 -ナミダ-
Movie Theater After the Rain: Tears
Amefuri Eigakan: Namida
episode.summary: Tsugumi finds herself inadvertently going to a movie with Akira and is pleasantly surprised when sees a new unexpected side of him. Meanwhile, members of the House of Peers who support the Prime Minister`s plan for disarmament are mysteriously dying and a Japanese-style book has been found by each of their bodies; the members of Fukurou begin to see a connection. One day, Tsugumi is suddenly confronted by Shiginuma Takashi, the supposed leader of Karasu, and he offers her a difficult choice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 母の俤 -カワセミ-
Mother`s Face: Kingfisher
Haha no Omokage: Kawasemi
episode.summary: While out on their rounds one day, Tsugumi and Hisui learn of the existance of a book written by a prostitute from Yokohama`s redlight district. Hisui seems especially desperate to get his hands on this book and when Tsugumi learns the reason why she becomes determined to help him. When Tsugumi discovers that Shiginuma Shouko, wife of the shady owner of the Nachtigal dance hall, she finds herself stepping back into potentially dangerous territory alone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 紅月の夜 -ライラック-
Akatsuki Evening: Lilac
Akatsuki no Yoru: Lilac
episode.summary: When a number of female murder victims are discovered in Ueno Park with lilac flowers in their mouths and one of Shizuru`s books by their side, rumor spreads that he may have some involvement in the case. Worried for her friend, Tsugumi learns that the murders seem to be inspired by a certain book where both Shizuru and Sasagoi-san have ties to the author. When Shizuru is taken away by the police for questioning, Tsugumi works with the rest of Fukurou to find the real killer before it`s too late. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 帝都幻惑綺譚 -ニル・アドミラリ-
Bewitching Tales of the Imperial Capital: Nil Admirari
Teito Genwaku Kitan: Nil Admirari
episode.summary: Fukurou has been able to apprehend all the members of Karasu and they celebrate the resolution of such a major case. Just as everyone has started to think things are returning to normal, Tokimiya, Mashiko and Hayato discover a disturbing detail about Nabari and the cursed tomes linked to many of their own personal tragedies. Unaware of any of this, Tsugumi has brought Nabari with her on a visit home to celebrate her brother`s discharge from the hospital. Nabari lures Tsugumi and Hitaki into the Kuze family library under the pretense that there might still be another cursed tome there, but he locks the door with a dangerous glint in his eyes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 母と父と子と -キズナ-
Mother, Father, and Child: Bond
Haha to Chichi to Ko to: Kizuna
episode.summary: Driven to make the fake cursed tomes out of a desire to be recognized, Sasagoi is moved to tears by Shougo`s words of encouragement. Through a series of events, the true relationship between Akira and Shiginuma is revealed. However, Akira has found something he wants to protect himself and secures Shiginuma so he can be handed over to the police. The members of Fukurou track down the members of Karasu one after the other, but after Hisui fails to stop Professor Mozuyama, Rui finds himself facing down the cowardly man. Mozuyama shocks Rui with information about some truths about his parents. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 白亜の鳥籠 -トラウマ-
White-Walled Birdcage: Trauma
Hakua no Torikago: Trauma
episode.summary: Tsugumi was abducted as she was returning to the apartment and taken to Nachtigal. Shiginuma Takashi tells Tsugumi that he will take advantage of her powers and have her bear his child to succeed him. Meanwhile, having ascertained that the fake cursed tomes are being made in Nachtigal, Rui and his Kagutsuchi companions infiltrate the grand building in order to put a stop to this. In the midst of the confusion, Hayato, Hisui, and the others make their way into Nachtigal to search for Tsugumi. During the search, Hisui comes face to face with Professor Mozuyama, who has conducted numerous human experiments. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 凶鳥乱舞 -カラス-
Dance of the Evil Bird: Karasu
Magatori Ranbu: Karasu
episode.summary: Hayato`s friend from his college days and newspaper journalist, Yoshikiri Takuma, ends up trying to kill himself after reading a cursed tome disguised in the form of a mysterious letter planted in his bag from an unknown sender. He seems to have been targeted after getting too close to linking Karasu to the fake cursed tomes. With the help of Yoshikiri`s information Fukurou learns of his suspicions regarding Karasu, but before they are able to make a move Tsugumi is taken. Source: crunchyroll
